The '''NSW Self-Exclusion Scheme''' is a multi-venue self-exclusion (MVSE) program available in New South Wales, Australia. It allows individuals to voluntarily exclude themselves from multiple gambling venues, including clubs, hotels, and the casino, to help manage gambling-related issues.

== Multi-Venue Self-Exclusion (MVSE) ==
The MVSE program in New South Wales enables individuals to self-exclude from multiple gambling venues simultaneously. This approach is designed to provide a more comprehensive and effective means of limiting access to gambling environments across the state.

== Coverage ==
The NSW Self-Exclusion Scheme covers a wide range of gambling venues, including:
* Clubs
* Hotels
* The Star Casino in Sydney

This extensive coverage ensures that individuals seeking to control their gambling habits can do so across various types of venues.

== Registration Process ==
To register for the NSW Self-Exclusion Scheme, individuals must complete the following steps:
# Contact a participating venue or the MVSE program directly.
# Complete the self-exclusion application form.
# Attend a meeting with a venue representative or MVSE program officer to discuss the exclusion process and confirm details.

== Duration Options ==
Participants in the NSW Self-Exclusion Scheme can choose from various duration options for their exclusion. These options typically include:
* 6 months
* 12 months
* 24 months
* Indefinite period

The flexibility in duration allows individuals to select a timeframe that best suits their personal needs and circumstances.
